items.preText: 2:29pm Alright, we are ready to rock'n'roll at the ZACS. The Zimbabwean openers are heading out to the middle - Hamilton Masakadza and Cephas Zhuwao. Arun: "I ask what has Chigumbura done to retain his spot?" - Still an experienced hand, and someone who could come good at any stage. Mashrafe tells the broadcasters, "the bowlers have bowled really well. Last match, they might have scored 280-290, but our bowlers came back very strongly." Hamilton Masakadza admits that he's a little worried about the dew later on in the evening. "A win will set us up for the Tests." arif: ""Debayan", you are Bengali right? My guess is from West Bengal since the name "Debayan" is not common in Bangladesh. How many of your colleagues are from Bangladesh or Bengali? " - I am all sorts, Arif, but yes a Bengali by birth. I have actually covered both cricket and football in Bangladesh, and am quite familar with the streets of Dhaka, Chittagong, Sylhet and Jessore. But for Bangladesh cricket, our expert remains and shall always be the wise Mohammad Isam. Sawwn: "Fizz debuted in the Pak tour. But in the t20s. Still remember getting into the stadium and watching that skinny guy beating the edge of batsman sharply, wondering who is this guy! I think he got 2 wks in that match." Taif also tells me that Fizz took the scalp of a certain Shahid Afridi as his first wicket. Asif sternly rebukes me for sparking chatter about Banglawash, says he has a feeling Zimbabwe will fight back today. Isam, who is at the Zahur Ahmed Chowdhury, tells us, "Soumya replaces Fazle Mahmud at 3, Ariful in place of Mehidy Hasan at 8 and Hider in place of Mustafiz in the tail." Team news then... Bangladesh OUT: Fazle Mahmud, Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Mustafizur Rahman IN: Ariful Haque (debut), Abu Hider, Soumya Sarkar Zimbabwe OUT: Tendai Chatara, Brandon Mavuta IN: Richard Ngarava, Wellington Masakadza Asif and Walid both go for the 2010 Banglawash against New Zealand, citing Shakib's form in that series as a standout. razzie: "The Fizz hadn't debuted yet in the 2015 PAK series." - That wasn't all that was wrong with the pun, then? TQ corrects me as well, saying how he made his mark against India later that year. Who can forget that series in particular! "Regarding Jubayer Hasan Likhon, He has some bad luck. He didn't get picked by any team in BPL last year. Look like everyone lost faith in him. Rishad, a U19 player has potential to do well, but I saw he's not getting wicket in Srilanka." - Abdul Halim gives us one wrist-spinner to keep track of. Alamin: "Favourite Banglawash? I think everyone will have the same answer, nothing but pakistan 2015 " - That really put the Fizz in Bangladesh ODI cricket, didn't it? #notsorry "Too many changes will hamper at confidence level.just rest mashrafe and give chance to rubel." Well, Ashraf, we will have the team news for you soon. TOSS, 2pm: Bangladesh have won the toss, and will bowl first. "Best banglawash has got to be Pakistan 2015, winning our first ever ODi against them for almost 16 years and at that time, Tamim started batting really well and the whole team was rejuvenated after the WORLD CUP" - Great phase after the World Cup, wasn't it, TQ? My personal favourite would be New Zealand 2013. TQ: "I agree with @Lipu, last leg spinner from BD i remember was Jubair hossain (last played in 2015) who since has fallen out of order with the board. I think they are a valuable asset to have in any team in the modern era" - My colleague Deivarayan Muthu had the same answer, sitting just a couple of desks away, just a while ago. Both answers, as a matter of fact! Shauk Khan: "i would drop Miraz, bring Soummya in and give Fazle another chance as an all-rounder. Maybe use him as a bowler. Miraz has been giving away to many runs for me." - I can see from all the feedback that there are Bangladesh fans tuning in (if that's the correct phrasing?) from all over the globe. Which one was your favourite Banglawash, folks? "BD should produce some Leg spinners, this is the era of leg spinners like Rashid,Chahal,Baddri... But in The recent past BD haven't include any leggeis in their squads quite surprising. Perhaps they haven't any leg spinners in their pipeline." - Lipu has a point there. Bangladesh domestic cricket has had a much richer history of finger-spinners than wrist-spinners, though. So can't see this trend reverse anytime soon. mehedi38: "Shanto,Soumya,Ariful,ruble will replace by fazle,musfiq,mahmuduallah and fizz. I really want to give some rest to senior player like musi and mahmudallah ahead of test series." - Zimbabwe won't mind that one bit, I should imagine. "Soumya Sarker should get a chance instead of Fazle Mahmud " - Masud Kysar is adamant about the obvious selection choice today. Not long from the toss now, so we should have that answer as well. TQ: "I suppose Fazle will be dropped today and Soumya will come in his place? I would love to see Nazmul Shanto play today but who do you drop; Kayes who can break the record for msot runs in a 3 match series by a bangladeshi or Liton, who is explosive early on?" - TQ seems to have your answer :) Plabon: "will Soumya be playing today.?" - Drafting him into the squad would certainly suggest so. Who would you drop to accommodate him, Plabon? Adnan: "I would like to see Abu Haider instead of Mustafiz. Its a great chance for BD to go for an experiment the strength of bench ahead of the WC." - Fair point, especially because for perhaps the first time in their ODI history, Bangladesh seem to have a good crop of seamers. If they can identify the best men for the job, they could surprise a few people at the World Cup in England. 1:41pm Bangladesh had a comfortable win in the second ODI a couple of days ago thanks to a fine bowling performance from Mohammad Saifuddin, who removed some of the key Zimbabwe batsmen and never allowed the vistors' innings take any momentum. Here's a beautiful tale of some sage advice from his mother that he has used to motivate himself. 1:30pm Hello and welcome to Chittagong for the live commentary of the third and final ODI between Bangladesh and Zimbabwe. I'm Debayan Sen and I will be joined soon by Hemant Brar and Akshay Gopalakrishnan. Bangladesh have already wrapped up this series, and will be looking to seek out their 12th wipeout in a bilateral series of two matches or more. Three of their previous 11 such clean sweeps have involved Zimbabwe, who would be keen to gain some confidence ahead of the Tests that follow. Here's Mohammad Isam's preview.
items.text: outside off stump and left alone by Masakadza.
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: shapes back in, and takes the batsman by surprise. He defends well, though.
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: pitched up again, and this time he goes a little out of shape in driving. No fielder when it goes aerial, no run
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: swings back in, a polite appeal. Good start here by the bowler, though it was going well down leg
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: pitched up, and this time Masakadza gets it through the vacant mid-wicket region. Gets himself and his team off the mark with two
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, 2 runs

items.text: down the leg side, and takes the pad along the way. Goes all the way for four, spoiling what was otherwise a pretty good first over
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, 4 leg byes

items.preText: Saifuddin will start from the other end. Zhuwao, who had a good brief innings on Wednesday on strike.
items.text: length ball on the pads. No runs as he played it straight to short mid-wicket
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Zhuwao, no run

items.text: straight ball which forces Zhuwao to play it away defensively.
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Zhuwao, no run

items.text: GONE. Straight ball again, and he swings across the line without any footwork. Just clips the top of off-stump, and then there's Saifuddin's celebration where he thumps his chest.
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Zhuwao, OUT

dismissal.text: C Zhuwao  b Mohammad Saifuddin 0 (3b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.preText: Brendan Taylor is the new man in. Had a good innings going on Wednesday, before falling to a reverse sweep
items.text: straight up to him. Comes forward and defends.
items.postText: swapon: "I can remember fizz first international wicket was afridi and actually that was a not out. Afridi was looking for a reveiw but there was no reveiw in t20." - Your thoughts on Saifuddin?
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: defended off a length
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: strays on to the pads, but Taylor's shot is straight to the fielder stationed alongside the square-leg umpire
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: comes forward and defends. Mushfiqur Rahim approves of the length
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: raps him on the pad. They are contemplating a review. Good movement back into pads. Big wicket this, but Hider can't convince the senior players into going for it
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: played to covers, straight to the fielder stationed there
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, no run

items.text: chops this one onto the stumps. Bangladesh on fire at the moment. Almost had him LBW just a couple of balls ago, and now gets Masakadza to mistime an attempted drive completely. Bangladesh couldn't have asked for a better start.
items.shortText: Abu Hider to H Masakadza, OUT

dismissal.text: H Masakadza  b Abu Hider 2 (10b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00

items.preText:
Shahriar: "Debayan do you think Bangladesh is a favourite in the next World Cup ?" - Let's say they have the team for the conditions, provided the squad stays fit and in form. Favourite might be overstating it, though

Sean Williams comes in next. Zimbabwe need a partnership.
items.text: lovely shape away from the left-hander, though Williams too did see it straight through to the gloves of Mushfiq
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Williams, no run

items.text: almost had a dab at another away-swinger. Through to the keeper
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Williams, no run

items.text: played back to the bowler. Zimbabwe haven't had a run off the bat since the first over
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: this one keeps a bit low. Taylor has to bend to keep it out. Is there a bit of variable bounce that Zimbabwe could work with?
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: driven straight to the cover fielder. They need some patience here, and have two quality batsmen to build a partnership with
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: left this alone and it wasn't too far from his off stump
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: played away to the on-side, but not a possibility of a single
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: played away to the off-side. What a great over here from Saifuddin. Right on the money!
items.shortText: Mohammad Saifuddin to Taylor, no run

items.text: still keeps it outside off, and Williams is not interested in offering a shot yet
items.shortText: Abu Hider to Williams, no run
